page.title: 19Health in Hungerford.
page.content: The main surgery in Hungerford is operated by 3 doctors and the practice covers an area of 60 square miles. The majority of the 6,700 patients( 2,500 families) live in Hungerford, Chilton Foliat, Kintbury, Inkpen, Shalbourne, Great Bedwyn, Little Bedwyn and Ham. Visits upto a distance of 10 miles are made. Each doctor spends 5 hrs per day in the surgery and 2/3 hours on visits These times are staggered so that the surgery is open from 8.30am to 6.30pm each weekday.Patients requiring hospital treatment are taken to Swindon or Reading in an emergency, although routine operations can be performed in Marlborough or Newbury. The town has an optician,a dentist and a vet.There are 2 sheltered housing projects for elderly people who have their own flats.Chestnut Walk also offers 24hr. a day care for old folk.
